chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Stanley J. Vaverka was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
360 days imposed as condition of probation, served concurrently to any other sentence,  good time allowed, with credit for 236 days time served; 90 days imposed and stayed conditionally upon completion of AODA; review hearing in 6 months to verify completion, 2 yrs license revocation, DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence. 2 years IID on any vehicle owned or operated. OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Absolute Sobriety.   No drug use without a valid prescription. No comsumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink. Fine/costs of $ 1,744.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.
24 Months plus 360 days revocation. DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID for 24 months effective 45 days   On any vehicle owned or operated.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$ 250.00 DNA Surcharge   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute Sobriety.   No comsumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink.  No drug use without a valid prescription.
Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.

OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.

OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Absolute Sobriety.   No drug use without a valid prescription. No consumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink. Fine/costs of $ 1,744.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.

Bond Continues.   15TR1190 Track with Case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
